paper_title.en: An attempt to track the depletion of the released abalones, Haliotis gigantea

description.ja: 1)サイトカラシンB(0.lmg/-)処理により誘起したアコヤガイ3倍体貝を2倍体貝と混合して飼育し、ふ化36ケ月後まで成長・生残・成熟を調査した。 2)成長では、2倍体貝と3倍体貝の間に大きな差は認められなかった。 3)生残は、ふ化22ケ月後まで差は認められなかったが、36カ月後では3倍体が2倍体より劣っていた。 4)成熟については、3倍体貝でも一部の個体では若干の成熟の進行が観察されたが完全な成熟状態にある個体は認められず、また、多くの個体では成熟が全く進行しなかった。

paper_title.ja: ヒラメの人為的雌化におけるステロイドホルモン（β－エストラジオール）の投与開始時期と投与期間

description.ja: β－エストラジオール(E2)の経口投与(E2添加量5μg/g)によってヒラメ種苗の全雌化を効率的に行うために、E2の投与開始時期と投与期間について検討し、以下の結果を得た。 1.全ての個体が雌化したE2の投与期間は、ふ化後36日目から90日目までと、ふ化後36目目から75日目までであった。従って、全ての個体を雌化するためには、ふ化後36日目から75日目までE2を投与すればよいと考えられた。この期間を全長で示すと15.6±1.2mmから73.2±4.Ommまでとなる。 2・ふ化後55日目(全長33.9±4.7mm)からE2投与を行った実験区において96%、ふ化後60日目(全長46・7±5・4mm)でE2投与を打ち切った実験区において80%のそれぞれ雌出現率を示した。この値は対照区の出現率(19.6%)と比較してかなり高く、今回の実験における添加量ではE2投与が短期間でもかなり雌出現率は上がるものと考えられた。 3ホルモン投与により生殖腺・肝臓・腎臓への悪影響が認められ、長期間E2を投与することによって生残率が低下した。

publisher.ja: 三重県水産技術センター

publication_name.ja: 三重県水産研究所研究報告

paper_title.en: CHROMOSOME BEHAVIOR OF MEIOSIS-INHIBITED EGGS WITH CYTOCHALASIN B IN JAPANESE PEARL OYSTER
paper_title.ja: サイトカラシンB処理により成熟分裂を阻害したアコヤガイ卵の染色体

description.en: For efficient induction of triploid pearl oyster, the effect of cytochalasin B (CB) treatment on meiosis and fertilization of eggs in Japanese pearl oyster <i>Pinctada fucata martensii</i> was investigated. CB treatment (0.1mg/1) was initiated at 5 min after insemination for 10 min (CB 1) or initiated at 15 min after insemination for 15 min (CB 2). In CB 2, two groups of chromosomes at anaphase of second meiosis became two female pronuclei at 33 min after insemination due to the lack of second polar body formation. In CB 2, 51.1% of eggs had two female pronuclei and one male pronucleus at 33 min after insemination. Chromatin of these three pronuclei gradually condensed and became metaphase chromosomes for first cleavage. Eggs with three pronuclei seemed to develop into triploid embryos. In CB 1 the percentage of eggs with three pronuclei was lower (16.6% at 33 min) than that of CB 2. In CB 1 we classified abnormal chromosome behavior of eggs into following typical two types: (1) both first and second polar bodies formation was inhibited. Eggs formed four or five pronuclei. (2) At anaphase of first cleavage one pronucleus derived from second polar body was still observed. The percentage of these abnormalities was higher in CB 1 than in CB 2.
description.ja: For efficient induction of triploid pearl oyster, the effect of cytochalasin B (CB) treatment on meiosis and fertilization of eggs in Japanese pearl oyster <i>Pinctada fucata martensii</i> was investigated. CB treatment (0.1mg/1) was initiated at 5 min after insemination for 10 min (CB 1) or initiated at 15 min after insemination for 15 min (CB 2). In CB 2, two groups of chromosomes at anaphase of second meiosis became two female pronuclei at 33 min after insemination due to the lack of second polar body formation. In CB 2, 51.1% of eggs had two female pronuclei and one male pronucleus at 33 min after insemination. Chromatin of these three pronuclei gradually condensed and became metaphase chromosomes for first cleavage. Eggs with three pronuclei seemed to develop into triploid embryos. In CB 1 the percentage of eggs with three pronuclei was lower (16.6% at 33 min) than that of CB 2. In CB 1 we classified abnormal chromosome behavior of eggs into following typical two types: (1) both first and second polar bodies formation was inhibited. Eggs formed four or five pronuclei. (2) At anaphase of first cleavage one pronucleus derived from second polar body was still observed. The percentage of these abnormalities was higher in CB 1 than in CB 2.

publisher.en: JAPAN SOC SCI FISHERIES TOKYO UNIV FISHERIES

paper_title.en: MEIOSIS AND FERTILIZATION OF THE JAPANESE PEARL OYSTER EGGS AT DIFFERENT TEMPERATURE OBSERVED WITH A FLUORESCENCE MICROSCOPE
paper_title.ja: 蛍光顕微鏡観察による異なる水温下でのアコヤガイ卵の減数分裂と受精

description.en: The events of meiosis and fertilization in Japanese pearl oyster eggs allowed to develop at dif-ferent temperatures (18&deg;C, 23&deg;C, and 28&deg;C) were investigated with fluorescence microscope. Change of matemal and paternal chromatin of eggs at 23&deg;C were as follows. Spawned eggs were at metaphase of first meiosis. Subsequent to sperm penetration most eggs completed first and second meiosis by 15 and 24 min after insemination, respectively. Female and male pronuclei were formed by 30 min after insemination. The chromatin of male and female pronuclei con-densed gradually and were finally observed as two groups of chromosomes. The two groups of chromosomes combined and formed on the metaphas plate for first cleavage. By 62 min most eggs completed first cleavage.<br> It was observed at the higher temperature, that the eggs developed faster. Percentages of eggs which showed abnormal chromosome behavior were higher at 18&deg;C and 28&deg;C than at 23&deg;C. Asynchronous development of eggs was observed in all temperature groups. Asynchrony of eggs development was more apparend at 18&deg;C.
description.ja: The events of meiosis and fertilization in Japanese pearl oyster eggs allowed to develop at dif-ferent temperatures (18&deg;C, 23&deg;C, and 28&deg;C) were investigated with fluorescence microscope. Change of matemal and paternal chromatin of eggs at 23&deg;C were as follows. Spawned eggs were at metaphase of first meiosis. Subsequent to sperm penetration most eggs completed first and second meiosis by 15 and 24 min after insemination, respectively. Female and male pronuclei were formed by 30 min after insemination. The chromatin of male and female pronuclei con-densed gradually and were finally observed as two groups of chromosomes. The two groups of chromosomes combined and formed on the metaphas plate for first cleavage. By 62 min most eggs completed first cleavage.<br> It was observed at the higher temperature, that the eggs developed faster. Percentages of eggs which showed abnormal chromosome behavior were higher at 18&deg;C and 28&deg;C than at 23&deg;C. Asynchronous development of eggs was observed in all temperature groups. Asynchrony of eggs development was more apparend at 18&deg;C.

publisher.en: JAPAN SOC SCI FISHERIES TOKYO UNIV FISHERIES

paper_title.ja: イシガレイ仔魚の生残に及ぼす飼育環境の影響

description.ja: イシガレイ仔魚の好適な飼育環境を把握することを目的として、同一雌魚から得たイシガレイ仔魚を用いて、異なる物理的理境条件(光・塩分濃度・飼育水の管理方法)下でふ化後40日目まで飼育実験を行い、次の結果を得た。 (1)透明水槽ではイシガレイ仔魚の示す趨光性のために、仔魚は特定箇所に集まり、大量斃死の原因となったが、側面を遮光した水槽では適度に仔魚を分散でき、仔魚の飼育に有効であった。 （2)飼育水の塩分濃度については、100%海水より60%海水の方が生残・成長ともに優れ、60%海水の方が飼育水として適していると判断された。 (3)飼育水の管理方法については、止水式と流水式でふ化後24日目まで生残・成長ともに変わりなく推移したが、その後は、止水式では水質の悪化が顕著となって斃死が増え、流水式が適当と思われた。
